DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: FREITAS RACHID, F. B. ou RACHID, F. B. F.;DE FREITAS RACHID, FELIPE BASTOS;RACHID, F.B.F.;FREITAS RACHID, F;RACHID, F. B. FREITAS;RACHID, FELIPE B. FREITAS;DE FREITAS RACHID, F;RACHID, F. B. DE F.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação em Engenharia Mecânica pela Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro (1984), mestrado em Engenharia Mecânica pela Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro (1988) e doutorado em Engenharia Mecânica pela Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro (1993). Atualmente é professor associado da Universidade Federal Fluminense. Tem experiência na área de Engenharia Mecânica, com ênfase em Mecânica dos Fluídos e Mecânica dos Sólidos, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: transientes em fluidos, interação fluido-estrutura, escoamentos em oleodutos e gasodutos.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Engenharia Mecânica from Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro (1984), master's at Mechanical Engineering from Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro (1988) and doctorate at Mechanical Engineering from Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro (1993). Has experience in Mechanical Engineering, focusing on Mechanic of Fluids, acting on the following subjects: fluid transients, transientes em fluidos, pipeline, oleodutos and continuum damage mechanics.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Escoamentos Complexos: Da Cavitação à Interação Fluido-Estrutura
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto tem como objetivo a formulação de modelos mecânicos para a descrição de escoamentos complexos e a proposição de técnicas de aproximação numérica para obtenção da solução das equações que os governam. Os modelos mecânicos são invariavelmente construídos no âmbito da Teoria de Contínuo para Misturas à luz da Termodinâmica dos Processos Irreversíveis.Sete problemas distintos são abordados no projeto: cavitação vaporosa, cavitação gasosa, formação de mistura no escoamento seqüencial de fluidos miscíveis dissimilares, atrito dependente da freqüência em escoamentos unidimensionais em dutos e interação fluido-estrutura, com esforços de torção e flexão, modelagem do movimento de pigs em gasodutos e oleodutos e escoamento bifásico. Em alguns casos, a abordagem desses problemas é feita inicialmente de forma separada e, posteriormente, de forma conjunta de tal forma que a formulação de modelos envolvendo, num só contexto, ambas as cavitações faz parte de seu escopo. Dentre outras áreas, a pesquisa desenvolvida no âmbito do projeto tem de aplicação específica em engenharia na área de escoamentos em dutos.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Este projeto tem como objetivo a formulação de modelos mecânicos para a descrição de escoamentos complexos e a proposição de técnicas de aproximação numérica para obtenção da solução das equações que os governam. Os modelos mecânicos são invariavelmente construídos no âmbito da Teoria de Contínuo para Misturas à luz da Termodinâmica dos Processos Irreversíveis. Cinco problemas distintos são abordados no projeto: cavitação vaporosa, cavitação gasosa, formação de mistura no escoamento seqüencial de fluidos miscíveis dissimilares, atrito dependente da freqüência em escoamentos unidimensionais em dutos e interação fluido-estrutura, com esforços de torção e flexão. Em alguns casos, a abordagem desses problemas é feita inicialmente de forma separada e, posteriormente, de forma conjunta de tal forma que a formulação de modelos envolvendo, num só contexto, ambas as cavitações faz parte de seu escopo. Dentre outras áreas, a pesquisa desenvolvida no âmbito do projeto tem de aplicação específica em engenharia na área de escoamentos em dutos.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Modelagem do Movimento de Pigs em Regime Transiente

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In the present work a simple one-dimensional mechanical model is presented, along with a numerical technique, for the computational simulation of transients during pigging operations in pipelines conveying liquids. Friction forces of hydrodynamical and mechanical nature acting on the pig-pipe interface are taken into account in the modeling of pig motion, as well as the by-pass flow rates. The liquid is treated as a sligthly compressible medium. The model describing the dynamics of both, the pig and the fluid, consists on a system of hyperbolic partial differential equations with a moving boundary. The evolution of the moving boundary is governed by a set of non-linear ordinary differential equations. The numerical procedure is constructed by using the method of characteristics together with a Runge-Kutta type scheme for the integration of the differential equations in the neigborhood of the moving boundary. The numerical simulations carried out permit to analyze the coupled behavior of pig and fluid, demonstrating how the interaction of these motions affects the overall dynamic response of the system. Predictions obtained by using this model exhibit a qualitatively good agreement with physical phenomena reported in literature and by technical field staff.
(*) O aluno foi parcialmente financiado com bolsa de estudos cedida pela PETROBRAS.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Modelagem e Simulação de Carneiros Hidráulicos

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Fundação Carlos Chagas Filho de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado do RJ

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Hydraulic rams take advantage of the waterhammer phenomenon for liquid pumping action. When provided with large flow at low pressures from available hydric sources, the ram pimp is capable to discharge a portion of the income flow against a much larger head. Because its opertion does not require external sources of power, hydraulic rams are widely used in developing countries in applications related to irrigation and water supply of distant agricultural sites. On the other hand, due to historical reasons the design of such devices has experienced little change since it was first manufactured in commercial scale. Although the principle of operation of a typical hydraulic ram is well known, comprehensive theories of the operating cycle are somewhat insufficient in offering practical information when one wishes to optimize its design. Aiming to improve its design and hence its efficiency, a typical hydraulic ram pump is modelled and then simulated numerically in this work. The modelling encompasses a coupled mechanical description of the air chamber, impulse valve and the wave propagation processin the delivery and drive pipes. Several significant physical parameters such as operating and delivery flow and head, impulse valve head loss curve are taken into account. Numerical simulations were carried out by using the characteristic method. Experimental data of the impulse valve frequency, delivery and drive mean flow rates were measured for a particular ram pump installation. The model predictions and the experimental results are then compared and shown to be qualitatively in good agreement.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents a theoretical investigation, based on numerical simulations, of the wave propagation phenomenon in damageable elasto-viscoplastic one-dimensional medium. The degradation of the medium induced by inelastic deformations is described by a local continuum damage model in a context of internal variable theory. To solve the hyperbolic governing equations, the Glimm's scheme along with a splitting technique were used. Numerical simulations with and without damage are compared so that the influence of the damage on the wave propagation phenomenon is highlighted. Discontinuous initial fields of damage are also simulated in order to better characterize the effects of a damaged stretch replacement on the dynamical behavior of the structure.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Determinação do Volume Contaminado em Transferências em Batelada em Polidutos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents a model for predicting the contaminated mixing volume, which arises in pipeline batch transfers without pigs or scrapers. The proposed technique represents an extension of Netchval's model, which takes into account time-dependent flow rates and concentration-varying virtual dispersion coefficients. The governing equation of the model forms a non-linear boundary-value problem that is solved by a finite element method coupled to the Newton's method. A comparison among the theoretical predictions of this method, a field test and other classical procedures shows that the proposed method exhibits the best estimate over the whole range of admissible concentrations investigated.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Detecção de Vazamentos em Linhas de Transmissão de Líquidos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents the development of leak detection and localization algorithms for pipelines carrying liquids. The first algorithm is based on the integrated balance of mass inside the line whereas the second one stems on the head loss equation for fully developed flows. Isothermal fluid flow is considered as a basic assumption. The leak detection criterion is established by determining appropriately the uncertainties of all the terms in the balance equation of mass. The leak detection algorithm takes into account the packing/unpacking phenomenon which takes place in the line as a result of typical operational procedures, such as pump start-up and pump shut-down and valve operations. Such a feature enables its operation in not only steady but also unsteady regimes. The spatial pressure field is continuously evaluated by solving simultaneously the differential equations of conservation of mass and momentum. This task is performed by using the flow rate and pressure data, which is made available at the pipeline ends by the Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system. The numerical solution of the differential equations is conducted with the aid of the method of characteristics by employing the data of the SCADA as initial values. The algorithm performance is evaluated by using a data base of leaks, constructed within this work through numerical simulations. The system analyzed comprises a pipeline 50 km long, having a scan rate of 15 seconds, with leaks at two distinct sites along the line and leak flow rates ranging from 1.5% to 13% of the nominal flow rate under steady state and moderate and severe transient regimes. The obtained results indicate that the leak detection algorithm is a promising tool, especially for simple pipelines without batches. On the other hand, it is also shown that the localization algorithm is efficient as long as the line operates in steady and moderate transient regimes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Análise da Incerteza Associada à Localização de Vazamentos em Tubulações Transportando Bateladas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work a methodology for detecting leaks in pipelines carrying batches is investigated by means of an uncertainty analysis. The technique investigated is based on the head loss equation for isothermal developed flows. The mixture zone originated at the products' interface due to the mass dispersion phenomenon is disregarded in the analysis as a simplifying assumption. The application of this model to a segment of a line with a batch and a leak allows one to express the leak location in terms of leak detection operational variables (flow and pressure measurements at the inlet and outlet of the line), hydraulic resistance of the fluids being transported and also in terms of the mixture conventional half-length. The uncertainty analysis carried out for a volume balance leak detection system shows that the leak location uncertainty may be expressed in terms of the uncertainty associated to the operational variables (which characterize the instrumentation quality installed on the line), the leak magnitude and location, the position of the mixture half-length in the line and the elapsed time spent to announce the leak. Numerical simulations were carried out by assigning different values to the flow and pressure uncertainties in order to predict the model performance at varied flow regimes (nominal or low flow rates) under the use of distinct instrumentations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Estudo da Influência da Irreversibilidade do processo de Mudança de Fase em Cavidades Dinâmicas

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents a continuum thermo-mechanical coherent model to describe isothermal flows of incompressible liquid with cavities filled with vapor and a non-condensable gas. The motions of the constituents inside the cavities are described with the aid of the continuum mixtures theory, while the liquid motion description is accomplished by the classical continuum theory. The concepts of the singular surface theory are used to provide the additional interfacial balance equations. Irreversible phase change transformations are accounted for in such a way that the interfacial entropy inequality is always satisfied, regardless the singular surface shape and the initial and boundary conditions. The model is used to investigate the influence of the irreversibility associated with the phase change process on the cavity dynamics. To do so numerical simulations are carried out for two distinct problems. In the first problem, the influence of the phase change process on the collapse of a single bubble is analyzed. The second problem aims to investigating the effects of interfacial kinetic energy flux and stress on the phase change process, when an external harmonic pressure pulse is introduced in the liquid far away from the cavity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Formulação de um Modelo de Atrito Viscoso para Fluidos Newtonianos em Escoamento Unidimensional Não-Permanente em Dutos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents a consistent thermo-mechanical model based on the continuum theory of mixtures to describe the unsteady friction in one-dimensional fluid flows in deformable piping. The real fluid flow is treated as a virtual structured motion of several constituents, all of them having the same equation of state. The governing equations are derived in a systematic and coherent thermodynamic basis. The constitutive parameters of the model are easily determined from the knowledge of the actual velocity profile in steady state. It constitutes one of its advantages when compared to other existing models since no empirical parameters or experimental tests are required. The governing equations form a system of hyperbolic partial differential equations whose numerical approximation is carried out by using the method of characteristics with specified time interval. A comparison with experimental data reveals that the predictions of the proposed exhibit an excellent agreement for laminar flows.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents a mechanical model for simulating the non-isothermal behavior of damageable inelastic solids under dynamical loadings. The main motivation of this study is to investigate, by menas of numerical simulations, the thermomechanical coupling in a simple one-dimensional problem involving the wave propagation phenomenon in a damageable non-isothermal solid. To achieve this goal, the equation of energy is taken into account in the modeling with the coupling terms between the thermal and mechanical effects. The damageable inelastic mechanical behavior is described by means of an internal variable constitutive theory and the analysis is restricted to elasto-viscoplastic solids. The resulting system of non linear partial differential equations is solved by using an operator splitting technique, along with classical numerical procedures such as the Glimm's method. Numerical examples which illustrate damage and temperature evolutions induced by the plastic deformation process due to impact loadings are presented and analyzed. A suitable comparative analysis between simulations with and without the thermomechanical couplings shows the situations under which these terms are relevant.
